title: File Systems Quiz
description: Quiz covering operating systems file systems.

questions.text: What is a file system?
questions.explanation: A file system is a method of storing and organizing computer files and the data they contain to make it easy to find and access them.
correctAnswers: Method of storing and organizing files

questions.text: Which of the following is a Windows file system?
questions.explanation: NTFS (New Technology File System) is a Windows file system.

questions.text: ext4 is a Windows file system.
questions.explanation: ext4 is a Linux file system.

questions.text: Which of the following is a Linux file system?
questions.explanation: ext4 is a Linux file system.

questions.text: What is the purpose of a file extension?
questions.explanation: A file extension indicates the file type.

questions.text: A hard link creates a new copy of a file.
questions.explanation: A hard link creates a new directory entry that points to the same inode as the original file.

questions.text: What is an inode?
questions.explanation: An inode is a data structure that stores metadata about a file.

questions.text: What is a symbolic link?
questions.explanation: A symbolic link is a file that contains a reference to another file or directory.
correctAnswers: File containing reference to another file

questions.text: Deleting a symbolic link deletes the original file.
questions.explanation: Deleting a symbolic link only deletes the link, not the original file.

questions.text: What is the purpose of a partition?
questions.explanation: A partition is a logical section of a physical storage device.

questions.text: What is the purpose of a file system journal?
questions.explanation: A file system journal is used to ensure data integrity in case of a system crash.

questions.text: FAT32 supports file sizes larger than 4GB.
questions.explanation: FAT32 does not support file sizes larger than 4GB.

questions.text: Which of the following is a characteristic of NTFS?
questions.explanation: NTFS supports file permissions and access control lists (ACLs).

questions.text: What is the purpose of a volume?
questions.explanation: A volume is a logical storage unit that can span multiple physical devices.

questions.text: A sector is the smallest unit of storage on a hard drive.
questions.explanation: A sector is the smallest unit of storage on a hard drive.

questions.text: What is the size of a typical sector on a hard drive?
questions.explanation: A typical sector on a hard drive is 512 bytes.

questions.text: What is the purpose of a platter in a hard drive?
questions.explanation: A platter provides a surface for storing data magnetically.

questions.text: A track is a concentric circle on a hard drive platter.
questions.explanation: A track is a concentric circle on a hard drive platter.

questions.text: What is the purpose of memory paging?
questions.explanation: Memory paging is a memory management technique that utilizes secondary storage to increase the capacity of primary storage.
correctAnswers: Increase the capacity of primary storage

questions.text: What is the Windows equivalent of a swap partition in Linux?
questions.explanation: The Windows equivalent of a swap partition in Linux is the page file (pagefile.sys).
